Name: Issue 312
Introduction: G'day everyone, Hope you are having an excellent week and ready for a load of Xamarin and MAUI related content.  Apologies for the late newsletter. I'm working to get some people to help out with curation so we can get dates back on track. Stay tuned, but as always if you have any articles you want to submit, please do so here: [https://bit.ly/WeeklyXamarinSubmit](https://bit.ly/WeeklyXamarinSubmit). Oh by the way, Lachlan and I have released a new version of the [Weekly Xamarin app](https://weeklyxamarin.github.io/website/) with some community editions like filtering by topic - thanks to all the people who have submitted pull requests! Have a great week everyone! ❤ Kym

Articles.Title: How to design delightful dark themes
Articles.Description: Dark themes are the latest trend in app design. Here we share how to design dark themes that are readable, balanced, and delightful!
Articles.Author: Teresa Man

Articles.Title: Using the Xamarin REPL Tool - Trailhead Technology Partners
Articles.Description: Xamarin REPL (read-eval-print-loop) is one of the most important tools for building Xamarin.UITest tests. It’s a console-like environment in which we can see the structure of the visible part of our application using queries and commands.
Articles.Author: Masha Altukhova

Articles.Title: HTTP trick to check if a remote resource exists
Articles.Description: Mobile network connections are extremely varied from bad underground connections to speedy 5G connections. Being able to handle this can make the difference between users loving an app, or hating it. To avoid long UI delays with a loading animation and/or text message, or worse just something appearing to freeze, we can do a really quick HTTP call to check a resource exists ahead of actually trying to utilise the resource.
Articles.Author: Matt Crombie

Articles.Title: Manage your mobile application version automatically with GitHub Actions
Articles.Description: Automate the versioning of your application. Damien Aicheh has created a new set of free GitHub Actions to use in your workflow. These actions provide a way to extract the version from a Git repository tag and apply it to your project as you want.
Articles.Author: Damien Aicheh

Articles.Title: Mobile.BuildTools 2.0
Articles.Description: Dan announces Mobile.BuildTools 2.0 with a bit of history and some of the awesome new features it contains.
Articles.Author: Dan Siegel

Articles.Title: Getting started with a Xamarin.Forms UI Design
Articles.Description: Leomaris takes a gentle approach to understaning how to think about your page layout in this post
Articles.Author: Leomaris Reyes

Articles.Title: Getting Started with the BadgeView control for Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: Learn how to create badges and attach them to any Xamariin.Forms view you have.
Articles.Author: Yana Kerpecheva

Articles.Title: Working with Behaviors
Articles.Description: Behaviors lets you add functionality to user interface controls without having to subclass them. Behaviors are written in code and added to controls in XAML or code.
Articles.Author: Delpin Susai Raj

Articles.Title: Faster & Safer XAML with Compiled Bindings in Xamarin.Forms & .NET MAUI
Articles.Description: Are you looking to make your Xamarin.Forms or .NET MAUI app even more performant? Look no further than compiled bindings. This piece of technology speeds up your app by compiling your data bindings ahead of time and has the additional bonus of compile type checking of your bindings. I walk through the few lines of coded needed.
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: Shadow Effect in Telerik UI
Articles.Description: Meet Telerik Shadow for Xamarin, WinUI and UWP. Bring on the material design concepts for your mobile and desktop apps.
Articles.Author: Dobrinka Yordanova

Articles.Title: Close applications programmatically
Articles.Description: Can you programmatically close your application... sure... should you? Well that's up to you. In iOS it's a no-no, but it can be done in Android and in some cases might even be useful.
Articles.Author: András Tóth

Articles.Title: The Future of Xamarin Community Toolkit
Articles.Description: With the release of .NET MAUI coming soon, here is the roadmap for the Xamarin Community Toolkit.

Articles.Title: Xamarin / .Net Maui discussion with Javier Suárez
Articles.Description: The community talks to Javier Suarez about #DotNetMaui and #Xamarin about everything new that is coming and about the current status of Xamarin. Note, the video is in Spanish so for English speakers turn on those auto generated subtitles.

Articles.Title: FreshMvvm Basic Navigation Concepts in Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: In this video we will learn why it's important to navigate to ViewModels instead of pages and more importantly: how to actually do just that!

Articles.Title: Xamarin.Forms MVVM Made Easy with FreshMvvm Framework
Articles.Description: Xamarin.Forms already has all the bits necessary to implement the MVVM pattern successfully. However, you can make your life easier by using a MVVM framework. In this video we will see FreshMvvm, the MVVM framework that I love using in my Xamarin.Forms apps!
